parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>False. There is no CMF number present in the provided post.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>False. The post does not refer to any specific parliamentary candidate by name or affiliation.  While it encourages voting, it doesn't endorse any particular candidate or party.</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>True. The post is a paid advertisement on Facebook, a public platform, and its message is clearly intended for a broad audience, not a specific individual or small group. The language used ("A parlamenti választásokon nagy részvételre kell számítani...") directly addresses the general population of voters.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>Partially True. The post's primary objective is to encourage voter turnout in the parliamentary elections. While it doesn't explicitly advocate for a specific candidate, the implication is that higher turnout benefits the overall democratic process.  The phrasing about potentially becoming "free prey" to "dark forces" if turnout is low could be interpreted as subtly pressuring voters to participate, but it doesn't directly promote a specific candidate or party.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>Partially True. The post presents information about the importance of voter participation in a parliamentary election.  It could be considered a form of civic engagement journalism, aiming to raise awareness about the electoral process. However, the slightly alarmist tone ("szabad prédájává válhatunk a sötét erőknek") pushes it beyond purely neutral information dissemination.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>False. The post doesn't express a personal opinion; rather, it presents a generalized argument about the importance of high voter turnout, albeit with a somewhat dramatic tone.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1367534737561445</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post encourages high voter turnout in the parliamentary elections. While it doesn't explicitly endorse any candidate or party, the phrasing used ("A parlamenti választásokon nagy részvételre kell számítani és, ha nem megyünk el elegen szavazni kieshetünk a parlamentből. Akkor pedig szabad prédájává válhatunk a sötét erőknek.") could be interpreted as subtly influencing voters.  The post is a paid advertisement, targeting a wide audience.  The lack of explicit endorsement of a candidate makes a definitive determination challenging.  However, the implicit pressure to vote, combined with the paid advertisement nature, leans towards it being a form of electoral propaganda.  The alarmist tone pushes it beyond simple civic engagement journalism.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>Maszol.ro</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Maszol.ro, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei reclame plătite pe Facebook (ID postare: 1367534737561445), după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, care, deși nu susține explicit un anumit candidat, exercită o influență subtilă asupra alegătorilor prin îndemnul la o prezență masivă la urne, folosind un limbaj alarmist ("A parlamenti választásokon nagy részvételre kell számítani és, ha nem megyünk el elegen szavazni kieshetünk a parlamentből. Akkor pedig szabad prédájává válhatunk a sötét erőknek.").  Efectul electoral al acestei postări este de a mobiliza alegătorii, fără a specifica însă pentru cine.  Reclama, cu o cheltuială de 100-199 RON, a atins 15.000-20.000 de impresii, având o estimare a acoperirii de 500.000-1.000.000 de persoane.  Datele de contact ale Maszol.ro sunt disponibile în Ad Library: kiado@maszol.ro și +407400001818.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
